definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The pranas are always moving, and the mind is ever-changing as well.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸總是運動的，思想也總是千變萬化。

sentences.english: At sunset the sky became a kaleidoscope of colors.
sentences.chinese: 夕陽西下時，天空的顏色千變萬化。

sentences.english: The search lights and the fireworks made the sky a kaleidoscope of colour.
sentences.chinese: 探照燈和焰火使得天空的顏色千變萬化。

sentences.english: Therefore, the ever-changing environment is very useful.
sentences.chinese: 所以環境的千變萬化是非常有用的。

sentences.english: I mean, I mean she is ever-changing.
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，她是千變萬化的。

sentences.english: Sri Lanka is a protean and wonderful paradise.
sentences.chinese: 斯里蘭卡是一個千變萬化和精彩萬分的人間天堂。
朋友之義，難在義字千變萬化。

sentences.english: Today the richness of beadwork varies with fashion.
sentences.chinese: 現今珠飾品工藝隨着時尚潮流而千變萬化。

sentences.english: But 2000 people at a time and there're old wishes here .
sentences.chinese: 世事千變萬化，然這艘船每次只載2000人。

sentences.english: We're more like blocks, but the myriads of changes cannot withstand a single blow.
sentences.chinese: 我們的關係多像積木啊，不堪一擊卻又千變萬化。

sentences.english: The clinical manifestations are protean with multisystem involvement.
sentences.chinese: 多系統受累的臨牀表現是千變萬化的。

definition: to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to blend into one another/to blend together well
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
